page.title: 06THORPE MARKET
page.content: There has been a market at Thorpe since the 14th century when a charter allowing a market to be held was drawn up. It has been on the present site since the railway came last century. Although it is by the side of the station and the Maltings, it is very quiet. We don't get many trains through nowadays. The Market is only open on Mondays and cars have to park all along the side of the road. There are a great many stalls of all kinds, some of them having covers over and some without. These are the ones that are always there and can be hired out. Other stalls are only folding tables and some of the people sell things from lorries.In the middle of the market is a pub called King Edward VII and it was built in 1901.
